page.title: 08Sulgrave Primary School.
page.content: Our school is about 18 metres long and a third of that is divided by a partition making two classrooms.There is no office.There are 18 pupils on roll this year,but we expect 26 next term.All the children live in the village or on outlying farms. The Headteacher is assisted by a part- time teacher and a Clerk/Ancillary helper.We have a Caretaker who is also the dinner-lady.We are too small a school to have hot meals provided at lunch-time,so if we need to stay we bring sandwiches.A music teacher visits us twice a week.We are part of a Rural Schools Enrichment Project.We use a mini-bus to take us on visits and we perform plays and concerts at least twice a year for our parents and the old people.We go swimming every two weeks at Brackley Baths and this year we spent three days on a canal boat.
